attributes.action: Provide a minimum of 10 days statutory paid leave for victims of domestic abuse
attributes.additional_details:
Australia and New Zealand already provide paid leave, and Northern Ireland / Ireland have passed legislation to provide for its introduction.
 
As a family lawyer I have seen first-hand the long-lasting traumatic emotional impact upon victims of domestic abuse. I have seen clients struggle to get time off work for important meetings such as applications for non-molestation orders or urgent Children Act applications. Victims should not be worried about finances at such a devastating point in their lives.
 
More needs to be done to offer victims assistance and support. Such a provision is a move in the right direction.
attributes.background:
The statistics over the years show that domestic abuse is regrettably prevalent and on the increase in our society.

Offering paid statutory leave for victims of domestic abuse is a sign of a progressive British society.
